p.s: In the extract of Act II scene 2 of William Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet the protagonists meet after Romeo sneaked onto a feast held by Lord Capulet.
Juliet is concerned about Romeo being a Montague and is worried that her relatives will kill him if they find him hiding in their Orchardorchard.
Romeo is not concerned by the risk of death and confesses to Juliet that he would rather die than be whithoutwithout her.
Juliet is concerned that Romeo is not serious about his love but gets convinced when he would swears on anything and also confenes her love.
